questions.text: The National Programme for Control Of Blindness has also included Eye harvesting and donation at the highest levels of Eye Care. Which of the following statements about Eye donation and banking is NOT TRUE?

options.label: A
options.text: Cornea should be harvested within 6 hours of the person's death

options.label: B
options.text: Eye banks create awareness, educate ordinary people and include them in related activities

options.label: C
options.text: Donors suffering from active Septicaemia at the time of death can be considered for donation as it doesn't transmit the infection to the host

options.label: D
options.text: Consent is a must from the next closest person legally

questions.correct_answer: C. Donors suffering from active Septicaemia at the time of death can be considered for donation as it doesn't transmit the infection to the host
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Donors suffering from active Septicaemia at the time of death can be considered for donation as it doesn't transmit the infection to the host Donors suffering from active Septicaemia at the time of death CANNOT be considered for donation as there is a high risk of transmitting the infection to the host. Consent is a must from the next closest person legally. The eyes must be processed before transplantation. Corneal tissue is also harvested from cadavers. Donors are screened for known medical conditions. Screening is done through history taking, examination, and serology testing. Transmissible Diseases like AIDS, Hepatitis or active Septicaemia, hematological malignancies, Rabies, or some other neurological conditions without a known origin are not considered because of the high risk of transmission to the host .

Highyeild:

The eye banks should harvest the cornea within 6 hours of the person's death. It is then processed and stored at four °C (sclera in alcohol). Eye banks also create awareness and include them in these activities.
